input_text:
Job Title: Assembly & Test Tech - Level 2 (1st shift) FAA

Location: Clearwater, FL

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Innovate to solve the world's most important challenges

Working at Honeywell isn’t just about developing cool things. That’s why all our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries.

Are you ready to help us make the future?

Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. You will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, or veteran status

As an Assembly & Test Tech Level 3 here at Honeywell, you will be responsible for performing assembly and testing of complex electronic components and systems. You'll work with a team of skilled technicians to ensure the highest quality standards are met. Your attention to detail and technical expertise will contribute to the success of our manufacturing operations

In this role, you will impact the efficiency and reliability of our electronic components and systems, ensuring they meet the highest quality standards. Your work will directly contribute to the success of our manufacturing operations and the satisfaction of our customers.

Key Responsibilities

1st shift 6:30am - 3:30pm Monday - FridayPerform assembly and testing of complex electronic components and systemsFollow detailed work instructions and proceduresTroubleshoot and resolve technical issuesEnsure compliance with quality standards and regulationsCollaborate with cross-functional teams to improve processes and efficiency

All applicants for placement in DOT/FAA safety-sensitive positions will be required to submit to a pre-employment drug test, testing for Marijuana, Cocaine, Amphetamines (amphetamine, methamphetamine, MDMA, MDA), Phencyclidine (PCP), and Opioids (codeine, heroin, morphine, oxycodone, oxymorphone, hydrocodone, hydromorphone). The DOT/FAA regulations require all employees, regular and temporary, in safety-sensitive positions, to be included in the Honeywell Anti-drug and Alcohol Misuse Prevention Plan.

U.S. Citizen REQUIREMENTS

Due to compliance with U.S. export control laws and regulations, candidate must be a US Citizen due to contractual requirements

YOU MUST HAVE

High School Diploma/GED Equivalent1+ years of experience in assembly and testing of electronic componentsStrong technical skills in electronic assembly and testing

WE VALUE

Experience with complex electronic systemsKnowledge of quality standards and regulations

Additional Information

JOB ID: HRD228859Category: Integrated Supply ChainLocation: 13350 US Hwy 19 N,Clearwater,Florida,33764,United StatesNonexemptMust be a US Citizen due to contractual requirements.

Global (ALL)

Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, religion, or veteran status.

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
